speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE II. The same.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter LADY MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That which hath made them drunk hath made me bold;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What hath quench'd them hath given me fire.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Hark! Peace!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: It was the owl that shriek'd, the fatal bellman,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Which gives the stern'st good-night. He is about it:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The doors are open; and the surfeited grooms

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Do mock their charge with snores: I have drugg'd

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: their possets,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That death and nature do contend about them,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Whether they live or die.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: [Within]  Who's there? what, ho!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Alack, I am afraid they have awaked,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And 'tis not done. The attempt and not the deed

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Confounds us. Hark! I laid their daggers ready;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: He could not miss 'em. Had he not resembled

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: My father as he slept, I had done't.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Enter MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: My husband!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I have done the deed. Didst thou not hear a noise?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: I heard the owl scream and the crickets cry.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Did not you speak?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Now.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As I descended?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Ay.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hark!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who lies i' the second chamber?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Donalbain.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: This is a sorry sight.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Looking on his hands

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: A foolish thought, to say a sorry sight.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There's one did laugh in's sleep, and one cried

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: 'Murder!'

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That they did wake each other: I stood and heard them:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But they did say their prayers, and address'd them

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Again to sleep.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: There are two lodged together.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: One cried 'God bless us!' and 'Amen' the other;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As they had seen me with these hangman's hands.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Listening their fear, I could not say 'Amen,'

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When they did say 'God bless us!'

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Consider it not so deeply.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But wherefore could not I pronounce 'Amen'?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I had most need of blessing, and 'Amen'

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Stuck in my throat.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: These deeds must not be thought

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: After these ways; so, it will make us mad.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Methought I heard a voice cry 'Sleep no more!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Macbeth does murder sleep', the innocent sleep,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Sleep that knits up the ravell'd sleeve of care,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The death of each day's life, sore labour's bath,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Balm of hurt minds, great nature's second course,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Chief nourisher in life's feast,--

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What do you mean?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Still it cried 'Sleep no more!' to all the house:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: 'Glamis hath murder'd sleep, and therefore Cawdor

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shall sleep no more; Macbeth shall sleep no more.'

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Who was it that thus cried? Why, worthy thane,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You do unbend your noble strength, to think

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: So brainsickly of things. Go get some water,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And wash this filthy witness from your hand.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Why did you bring these daggers from the place?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: They must lie there: go carry them; and smear

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The sleepy grooms with blood.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I'll go no more:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I am afraid to think what I have done;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Look on't again I dare not.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Infirm of purpose!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Give me the daggers: the sleeping and the dead

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Are but as pictures: 'tis the eye of childhood

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That fears a painted devil. If he do bleed,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: I'll gild the faces of the grooms withal;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: For it must seem their guilt.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Exit. Knocking within

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whence is that knocking?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: How is't with me, when every noise appals me?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What hands are here? ha! they pluck out mine eyes.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Will all great Neptune's ocean wash this blood

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Clean from my hand? No, this my hand will rather

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The multitudinous seas in incarnadine,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Making the green one red.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Re-enter LADY MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: My hands are of your colour; but I shame

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To wear a heart so white.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Knocking within

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: I hear a knocking

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: At the south entry: retire we to our chamber;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: A little water clears us of this deed:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: How easy is it, then! Your constancy

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Hath left you unattended.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Knocking within

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Hark! more knocking.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Get on your nightgown, lest occasion call us,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And show us to be watchers. Be not lost

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: So poorly in your thoughts.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To know my deed, 'twere best not know myself.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Knocking within

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Wake Duncan with thy knocking! I would thou couldst!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt
